content:
TABLE 1 FROM CAR INSURANCE:
Under the Loss or Damage to Your Car coverage, loss or damage by fire or theft is covered up to the market value at the time of loss or damage.
Under the Loss or Damage to Your Car coverage, loss or damage by other insured causes including Act Of God, fallen objects, riot, strike, or flood is covered up to the market value at the time of loss or damage.
questions: What types of losses are covered under the 'Loss or Damage to Your Car' coverage in car insurance?
Is theft covered under the 'Loss or Damage to Your Car' coverage?
What is the maximum coverage limit for damages under the 'Loss or Damage to Your Car' coverage?
Are damages due to natural disasters covered under the 'Loss or Damage to Your Car' coverage?
Does the car insurance cover damages caused by riots or strikes?
What does 'market value at the time of loss or damage' mean in the context of car insurance?
Are there any exclusions to what is covered by 'Loss or Damage to Your Car' in the car insurance policy?
How is the compensation calculated for a car damaged by fire under the car insurance policy?
Is damage from fallen objects included in the car insurance coverage?
What does 'Act of God' refer to in the context of car insurance coverage?
